name: script-wget_netgear-wrapper
description: Analysis of "usr/sbin/wget_netgear" indicates it is a shell script wrapper for the "wget" utility, but does not contain direct version information about "wget" or other third-party components. The script handles DNS hijacking scenarios when connecting to the netgear.com domain. Further analysis of the "/usr/bin/wget" binary is required to obtain version information for SBOM completion.
code_snippet:
#!/bin/sh
if [ -f "/tmp/wget_file_result" ]; then
	/bin/rm /tmp/wget_file_result
cfg_dns_hijack=$(/bin/config get dns_hijack)
if [ "$cfg_dns_hijack" = "1" ]; then
	/bin/config set dns_hijack="0"	#free dns hijack
	/usr/sbin/dns-hijack
/usr/bin/wget -T 10 -O - http://www.netgear.com | /bin/grep -i "netgear.com" > /tmp/wget_file
mv /tmp/wget_file /tmp/wget_file_result
if [ "$cfg_dns_hijack" = "1" ]; then	#recover dns hijack mode
	/bin/config set dns_hijack="1"
	/usr/sbin/dns-hijack
notes: configuration_load
